translated: to the one who receives the world’s offerings.
Through that faith in my mind,
leader of men, bull of men;
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of my single alms-food.
I have done what the Awakened One has taught.”🔽Thus the elder Ekasaññaka recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā ekasaññako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Ekasaññakattherassāpadānaṁ pañcamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmai ekasaññakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽ekasaññaka therassa apadānam pañcama
translated: The Elder Ekasaññaka’s Birth Story, the fifth.
